facebook.title: Why do workload spikes cause injuries, and which athletes are at higher risk? Mediators and moderators in workload–injury investigations
facebook.summary:
Training harder, but smarter

Avoiding rapid spikes in training seems like a no brainer, but it’s still a common approach to coaching. Often, the egos, enthusiasm, and competitive drive of the athlete, coach, and sports medicine team get in the way of this
Spikes in training & competition workloads, especially in undertrained athletes, increase injury risk. http://ow.ly/7vdp30e0meK #hcsm #SWSS
